newsitem.title: UK: Iran passes on white sugar buying tender - traders.
newsitem.headline: Iran passes on white sugar buying tender - traders.

text.p: Iran's Government Trading Corporation (GTC) probably opted not to buy white sugar at its recent tender, sugar sources said on Thursday.
Higher London futures prices could have persuaded the GTC to postpone its buying tender, they said. One supply offer was said to be as high as $306 per tonne.
Earlier this week the GTC tendered to buy a cargo of whites for April delivery, with Thailand, Brazil and the European Union (excluding the U.K.) as permitted origins.
Iran bought two 15,000-tonne cargoes of Cuban raw sugar this week at a reported price of $257 and $258 per tonne for March/April shipment, market sources said.
